release.action: Now parsing non-ASCII characters during lexical analysis.
Now parsing natural language constructs for limiting the version control history to a start date.
Improved LTC Editor to disable certain GUI controls when presented with an SVN-controlled .tex file, as setting "Self" and "Remotes" make no sense in that context.

Added a boolean setting (persistent) whether to condense authors or not. By default, this is off so we see all intermediate versions of the same author marked up. The mark up changes once we turn this setting on, resulting in skipping intermediate versions (as done in the original implementation).
LTC Editor now has a button (with shortcut CMD/CTRL-R) to open a dialog to create a bug report.
Install script does not rely on JDK anymore ('jar' tool) to unzip Emacs lisp files. The documentation has been adjusted.

About dialog now contains version information but license is only available via command line. All other command line tools have been adjusted to provide a mode of displaying the license. Small improvements to applications under Mac OS X. When we move to improved deployment (Ubuntu and Mac OS X), we can address these things more -- until then issue has been labeled as 'wont-fix'.
Fixing markup of replacement sentences -- instead of marking up alternating words as replacements, the longest subsequence of words is consecutively marked up.
Adding revision ID to change markup so that LTC Editor and Emacs mode now display the revision ID with each change when the user hovers over a marked up character.
LTC Server and Editor now runs under Linux again.

Emacs mode updates "modified" and "on disk" flags in history as soon as edit and save operations happen; revisions and dates are now click-able in history buffer of Emacs mode to use these for limiting history; improved menu labels and prompts for user; install script now includes hint how to reload the Emacs mode file if Emacs was running while updating
Better text for home page and link to Peter's web site.
Finalized logo and icon files.
Adding build information to About dialog, JAR manifest, and bug report.
Bug report generation now obeys parameter whether to include the source repository.
Emacs mode asks user now whether to include the source repository in bug report; it also provides a new command to set an author color without using a mouse-click.
Bug report creation now includes bundles (git) or zip file with file versions (svn).
Emacs mode has menu items for bug reports and jumping to next/prev change; also added robustness features and better failure messages
Fixed coloring of intermediate versions.
Added license information, copyright headers etc. Moving to hosting at http://latextrack.sourceforge.net. New logo and icon for applications.
Public SVN repository for testing and tutorial added.
Removed command line switch for specifying git binary as this is no longer needed.
Adding subversion support (the system automatically chooses between git or svn depending on the directory where the .tex file is located).
More bug fixes for accumulation: still some white space issues.
Started support for bug reports in Emacs (to be continued).
Customizable faces for addition and deletion in Emacs mode. Jump to next and prev change in Emacs mode.
Start tracking changes in this project.
